label: A_oF8_70_a-001
title: $\gamma$-Pu Structure
comments:
Plutonium has been found in a variety of structures (Donohue, 1982): \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A_mP16_11_8e-001}{$\alpha$-Pu} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A_mC34_12_ah3i2j-001}{$\beta$-Pu} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A_oF8_70_a-001}{$\gamma$-Pu} (this structure) \item $\delta$-Pu is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cF4_225_a-001}{face-centered cubic $A1$ structure} \item  $\delta$'-Pu is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A_tI2_139_a-001}{body-centered tetragonal $A6$ (In) structure} \item $\epsilon$-Pu is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cI2_229_a-001}{body-centered cubic $A2$ structure} \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 It is obvious from the coordinates that this is an extremely distorted \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cF8_227_a-001}{diamond ($A4$)} structure, but, as noted by (Donohue, 1982), it can also be considered as a distorted \href{current_web_home_dir/A_hP2_194_c-001}{hcp ($A3$) structure}.
